overrides.diff-instructions:
## Line Numbers
Use "NEW" for added [+] and context lines; use "OLD" only for deleted [-] lines.
overrides.analysis-process:
## Steps
1. Run git-diff-lines to get changed lines with numbers
2. Read full file only when needed for context
3. Anchor each suggestion to the exact line when possible
overrides.focus-areas:
## Find
- Correctness bugs and missing related changes
- File-level inconsistencies (naming, patterns, error handling)
- Security issues
- Performance or reliability risks
- Style violations
- Good practices (praise)
overrides.guidelines:
## Guidelines
- If a line anchor is not possible, use fileLevelSuggestions
- Omit suggestion for praise; include it for all other types
- Only include high-confidence suggestions
- Skip files with no issues
overrides.available-commands:
## Commands (READ-ONLY)
Use git-diff-lines first; otherwise `cat -n <file>`, ls, find, grep. Do NOT modify files.
